In this compilation, we will explore the top 10 Denver Nuggets of all time, a list that pays tribute to the men who have defined an era of Mile High basketball.

2. Alex English - Small forward

Alex English, a legendary figure in Denver Nuggets history, was one of the most prolific scorers the NBA has ever seen. Born in 1954, he joined the Nuggets in 1980 through a trade with the Indiana Pacers. English made an immediate impact in Denver, earning eight consecutive All-Star selections from 1982 to 1989.

His scoring prowess was characterized by a wide array of offensive moves, including his unstoppable mid-range jumper.

English's impact on the Nuggets franchise extended beyond his individual success. He helped the team consistently make playoff appearances, and his leadership on and off the court made him a beloved figure among fans. 3. Dikembe Mutombo - Center

Dikembe Mutombo, the iconic shot-blocker and defensive stalwart, left an indelible mark on the Denver Nuggets during his time with the team. Born in 1966 in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Mutombo was drafted by the Nuggets as the fourth overall pick in the 1991 NBA Draft.

Mutombo's defensive prowess was unmatched, and he led the league in blocked shots for multiple seasons. He was renowned for his signature finger-wag after rejecting opponents' shots. Mutombo's shot-blocking abilities earned him numerous Defensive Player of the Year awards and All-NBA Team selections. His presence in the paint was a game-changer, making it incredibly difficult for opponents to score at the rim.

Mutombo's tenure in Denver was relatively short but left a lasting impact. He was a key part of the Nuggets' success during the early 1990s, helping the team reach the playoffs. Jamal Murray is a rising star for the Denver Nuggets. As a point guard, he has shown exceptional skills and an ability to take over games with his scoring and playmaking. Murray was drafted by the Nuggets in 2016 and has rapidly become one of the key figures in the team's success.

7. Fat Lever - PG, SG

Lafayette "Fat" Lever is undoubtedly one of the best players in Denver Nuggets history. Lever was a versatile point guard and shooting guard who made a significant impact during his time with the team. He played for the Nuggets from 1984 to 1990, becoming an integral part of the franchise's success during the 1980s.

Lever was known for his exceptional ball-handling skills, court vision, and tenacious defense. Lever's ability to stuff the stat sheet made him a fan favorite and a crucial contributor to the team's success.

8. Dan Issel - PF, Center

Dan Issel is an iconic figure in Denver Nuggets history. He had a highly successful career with the franchise, playing for the team from 1975 to 1985. Issel was a dominant force in the frontcourt, capable of playing power forward and center with equal prowess.

One of his most memorable moments was his 53-point game against the Boston Celtics in 1978, a performance that showcased his scoring ability against one of the league's elite teams. Issel's impact on and off the court earned him the nickname "Horse," and his contributions to the franchise led to his jersey number 44 being retired by the Nuggets.

9. Chauncey Billups - Point guard

Chauncey Billups, often referred to as "Mr. Big Shot," is one of the greatest point guards in Denver Nuggets history. He played for the Nuggets in two separate stints, from 1998 to 2000 and then again from 2008 to 2011.

Billups was named an NBA All-Star five times during his career and earned the NBA Finals MVP award in 2004 while playing for the Detroit Pistons.

His ability to hit crucial shots in late-game situations earned him the "Mr. Big Shot" moniker, and he became a fan favorite in Denver. Billups' jersey number 1 was retired by the Nuggets in recognition of his immense contributions to the team and the city of Denver.
